hints.content:
Every coin has a different value.

Coin name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
Penny | ![Front and back photo of penny.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/d0799f515398b1f48cb0baa7bdc8d0c12e26c70c.png) | $1¢$
Nickel | ![Front and back photo of nickel.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f6c7ae82228012be92b624995809aeabc8e95370.png) | $5¢$
Dime | ![Front and back photo of dime.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/2017369b968caa0c88d046bddf2406665c8cd34d.png) | $10¢$
Quarter | ![Front and back photo of quarter.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1cc5cb6f4c779c49984f5a63a58443ce0ca96ff9.png) | $25¢$

Let's label the value of each set of coins and find the total.

![1, quarter. 4, dimes. 2, nickels. 3, pennies.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/e089c55409eda087988fdccd202ee0dcf7bffdb4.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}}  + \underbrace{\purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{4}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}+\maroonD{1¢} }_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}}  + \underbrace{\purpleD{40¢}}_{\purpleD{4}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{10¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{3¢}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ pennies}}}=78¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $78¢$, so it is **not** equal to $47¢$.

![1, quarter. 2, dimes. 2, nickels. 4, pennies.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/9ac46481166e8dbb6843095af2ab3d05cb818f77.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}}  + \underbrace{\purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{2}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}+\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{4}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}}  + \underbrace{\purpleD{20¢}}_{\purpleD{2}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{10¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{4¢}}_{\maroonD{4}{\text{ pennies}}}=59¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $59¢$, so it is **not** equal to $47¢$.

![1, quarter. 1, dime. 2, nickels. 2, pennies.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/4205ce7f90cf1ea7febf7aec499e91f34b4def22.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}}  + \underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}}  + \underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{10¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{2¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}=47¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $47¢$, so it **is** equal to Sanji's amount of money.

Sanji could have this set of coins:

![1, quarter. 1, dime. 2, nickels. 2, pennies.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/4205ce7f90cf1ea7febf7aec499e91f34b4def22.png)

question.content:
Sanji has $47¢$.

**Which set of coins could Sanji have?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
